content.rendered:
Thursday March 20th, 2025 

     Today is an “A” Day

          

  • Tomorrow is March Madness Friday so wear your favorite Toga gear or basketball jersey. 

 

  • To all 8th graders attending the semi-formal on Friday night: the dance will be here at Maple in the back gym. You will get dropped off and picked up by the back gym, no other entrances will be open for you. Tickets will be on sale through midnight tonight and can only be purchased online. For anyone thinking of wearing high heels, we strongly suggest that you wear sneakers to the dance so you will be comfortable on the dance floor. Can’t wait to see you there! 

 

  • Tomorrow is our last day to be a hero for our heroes. Asking for basic supplies and goods from students of all grades. In the fundraiser “Be a hero to our heroes” although its entirely optional, we’re asking you to donate things like food, clothing, personal care items and more. In addition, one flex per grade will be awarded with a treat for donating the most items out of their peers. So, let’s show our respect for both people in battle and returning veterans.  

 

  •  Our Lucky Duck Pond has some new visitors—frogs and turtles! They’re having a splashy party, and you’re invited to join the fun. Swing by during lunch and see if you can catch one of these cute guests! 

 

  • To all 6th graders, the Maple Avenue Parent Network will be hosting the 6th Grade Dance! The dance is open to all 6th graders and will take place on Friday, April 4th. There is a link on parent square to purchase tickets.  

 

  • Today’s lunch is mini corn dogs, seasoned potato wedges, rainbow pepper sticks and a yummy cherry blue raspberry ice cup.  

 

Check out the Maple Avenue Club Calendar for club meetings and room information! 
 

As always, BE SAFE, BE RESPECTFUL, BE RESPONSIBLE, BE KIND!
